solution_line_template: The lawyer worked {court_hours}*{prep_time_multiplier}=<<{court_hours}*{prep_time_multiplier}={prep_hours}>>{prep_hours} hours out of court
That means the hourly time cost {total_hours}*{hourly_rate}=$<<{total_hours}*{hourly_rate}={hourly_cost}>>{hourly_cost}
Adding the upfront cost it was {hourly_cost}+{upfront_cost}=$<<{hourly_cost}+{upfront_cost}={total_fee_before_brother}>>{total_fee_before_brother}
His brother paid half so he paid {total_fee_before_brother}/{brother_share_divisor}=$<<{total_fee_before_brother}/{brother_share_divisor}={johns_payment}>>{johns_payment}
